message: Could we embed a Convore group in our website and use it as our community forum?

Beyond embedding, I'm also wondering about user integration. ie how could a DotCloud user post a message without going through the Convore signup process half-way through, thus killing the user experience?
you can't embed a convore group and the users need to register to post a message

Unfortunately this is not a use case that we support yet officially.  You could definitely build this service on top of our API, or you could place a link to a Convore group, but right now we don't do embedding and thus we don't do single sign-on.
Both of these use cases are ones that we're considering though, going forward.
I think this is a great use case, and obviously a way to monetize. +1 for that.
@ericflo Could you pls elaborate on "build this service on top of our API"?
@vRideAlong you could take the API's build out some php scripts and using Jquery to give it that ajax, and there is your community forum
you need to find a HTTP 1.1 library it needs to be put into the packets you will never get a response to that call

@italiano40 Thanks. Do you have examples of using Convore API? I am a newbie and tried https://convore.com/api/account/verify.json?username=vridealong&password=mypwd but still it pops up a window asking for username and password. Could you or someone please help? Thanks

@vRideAlong https://github.com/italiano40/convore-php here is a convore php class, and i am been working on an open source forum that uses a convore group as a forum backend so just keep looking for that

@italiano40 But for Convore, when I used https://convore.com/api/account/verify.json?username=vridealong&password=mypwd I did not get a response but instead it showed a popup asking for username & password
@vRideAlong seriously just hire a C# coder, or find a convore library for C# because it will save you a lot of time
@vRideAlong yes because you can't do a GET call on that method
@italiano40 a dumb question (may be), can I use your PHP convore class along with ASP.NET?
@italiano40 Thanks, that is very useful. I am building it in C#(ASP.Net) hence could you tell what will the query look like? is it like https://convore.com/api/account/verify.json?vridealong:mypwd ?

@vRideAlong ok, i am not familiar with C# but your best bet is to look for a C# library to communicate with http 1.1 protocol since you need a basic auth for the api, and that can't be put into the url it has to be put into the packets sent to the api call
@vRideAlong i know nothing about ASP.NET so idk

@italiano40 Yes... however, it needs a URL to be broken down. For eg. for Google Books I used   https://www.googleapis.com/books/v1/volumes?q=Harry&maxResults=1&projection=lite and I get a JSON response
you should probably hire a coder to do it for you, you will need a basic understanding of web communication
@italiano40 Okay, I will find it out, thanks.
@italiano40 Okay, thanks. I will explore it. I have used HTTP GET queries but they all work from browser window as well hence am a bit confused
